column4: hey, how do i install something from a tarball? is it possible? or do i always have to go to the directory where i unpacked it, and run the shellscript? instead of having it in the applications menu.
is best to find out if its avaiblae as an ubutnu deb first.

im installing azureus (bittorent client). its already in the ubuntu repos, and i installed it, but it doesnt work. the program closes half a second after the splash screen finishes. so i asked in azureus, and they told me to download the tarball from the site instead..
there is a program called 'checkinstall' that will create  deb for source compiles. it helps when you want to unistall it.
